page.title: 18Tourism
page.content: In the Domesday Book of 1086 Hughenden Manor is referred to as Huchedene.It had been given to Bishop Odo of Bayeux at the time of The Conquest. The present house was built in 1738 in Georgian Gothic style.(The West Wing was added later.)It is famous because it was purchased in 1848 by Benjamin Disraeli,the great 19th century leader of the Tories and Prime Minister.He lived here with his wife,Mary Anne,when -ever possible as they loved the place. The house was given to the National Trust in 1947. Surrounded by woodland the Manor has a most attractive site with the brick and flint parish church of Hughenden nearby where Disraeli and his wife are buried. 27000 visitors came to the House in 1981,the centenary of Disraeli's death.
